attributes.gcd: Refers to the date as on which the snapshot of source data extracted for processing.
Refers to the Variable cash margin Receivable.
Refers to the total amount which is pledged as collateral by the financial institution.
Refers to the total amount of collateral received by the financial institution.

Refers to the settlement mechanisms used for Secured and Foreign Exchange products.
Following Secured products are identified using this table, LOV are as follows
TRIPARTY  secured financing transactions settled on the US based tri party platform,
OTHER  secured financing transactions settled on other e.g., non US third party platforms,
BILATERAL  secured financing transactions settled bilaterally.
Following Foreign Exchange products are identified using the table,
CLS  FX transactions centrally cleared via CLS,
OTHER  FX transactions settled via other non CLS central clearinghouses,
BILATERAL  FX transactions settled bilaterally. Column stores the codes for the settlement type dimension.

This attribute stores the Contractually maintained Collateral amount by the reporting entity and the counterparty. It is further used in computation of Excess Collateral to be posted by bank, formula: Net Exposure - Collateral Threshold Amount.

Refers to the Credit Conversion factor value for an exposure. It is applicable for undrawn part of on balance sheet and drawn and undrawn part of off balance sheet exposures and is used for calculating the effective amount of exposure for which credit risk needs to be calculated. This is expressed in decimal number, For example, 30 percent will be 0.3.

attributes.logicalName: Credit Default Swap Notional Offset Amount
attributes.gcd: Refers to the Notional offset amount of the credit default swaps.
Refers to the Credit risk exposure amount.
Refers to the CSA,Credit Support Annex, type whether ONE WAY or TWO WAY of a Netting Agreement.

Refers to the source system from where data is extracted. Data can be sourced from multiple sources, this column will Refers to the source code from where the data is extracted for this extraction date.
Refers to the collateral gross ups related to derivative contracts.

Refers to the trigger identifier for each account. A trigger is the set of condition in a accounts agreement that initiates a specific action in the event of a change in a firms credit rating. For example, a downgrade in a firms credit rating may set off posting additional collateral.

attributes.logicalName: Effective Credit Default Swap Notional Amount
attributes.gcd: Refers to the Effective Notional Amount of the Credit Default Swaps.
Refers to the excess margin amount for the reporting entityâ€™s customer to generate funding for additional purchases or short sales of securities or others.
Refers to the offsets in Gross Cash value of the exposure.
Refers to the Gross Exposure Amount before Netting.
Refers to the Gross Notional Amount of the exposure in the natural currency.

ISO currency codes is a standard published by the International Organization for Standardization 4217, which delineates currency designators and country codes, alpha and numeric. This column will capture the standardized currency code. Currency dimension is the equivalent dimension table for this column.

attributes.logicalName: Impacted Due To Change In Financial Condition Flag
attributes.gcd: Flag indicates whether there will be an impact due to change in financial condition for a netting agreement. List of values are Y and N.
Refers to the Indemnification Exposure Amount.

Refers to the date on which collateral was last exchanged between the counterparties. This is used in the calculation of margin period of risk for standardized approach for counterparty credit risk i.e. SA CCR approach.
Refers to the entity code of the legal entity to which the account will be attributed in the general ledger.

Flag indicates whether there will be a loss of rehypothecation rights for a netting agreement due to change in financial condition or due to change in rating of the legal entity. List of values are Y and N.
Refers to the Frequency of the Margin Amount.
Indicates the unit of margin frequency, List of values are D for days, M for month, Y for Year.
Refers to the threshold amount as agreed upon by the counterparty and the bank under a derivative contract.
Refers to the threshold applicable to posting of margin.

Refers to the market value of the instrument as on the As of Date. Market value of the asset is the price that would be received to sell an asset in an transaction between market participants on the given day. It is often the quoted market price which is available as part of market data and used to determine the market value of the asset.

attributes.logicalName: Maximum Thirty Days Cumulative Collateral Amount Over Twenty Four Months
attributes.gcd: Refers to the maximum cumulative value of collateral provided for derivatives. Maximum Cumulative value of collateral in this column refers to Maximum of 30 Days cumulative collateral amount over period of 24 Month. Value is in natural currency.
Refers to the minimum transfer amount as agreed upon by the counterparty and the bank under a derivative contract.
Refers to the Netted Exposure Amount.

Refers to the netting agreement code on which the contract is made. A netting agreement is an arrangement between two parties   known as counterparties   that governs the treatment of certain offsetting transactions or contracts. Two transactions offset each other if a gain in one results in a loss in the other. In other words, the transactions hedge each other. This allows for net settlement of all contracts governed by this netting agreement, with a single counterparty, through a single payment.
Refers to the number of margin dispute across all the trades in a netting set that have occurred in the last two financial quarters.
Refers to the unique identifier for the party. Party is defined as an entity or a person who takes part or is involved in an agreement, lawsuit, or transaction.

Flag indicates whether under ISDA you are permitted to net payment under one single transaction. If you have to net payments across different contracts then it has to be an add on agreement. Hence, need a payment netting agreement flag in addition to master agreement code. List of values are Y, N. If the flag is Y then netting is permitted.
Refers to the adjustments to potential future exposure.

Flag indicates whether the position is owned by the bank or is it taken on behalf of the customer. List of values are Y, N. In case the flag is Y then it is for own position of bank else its customer position. This flag is required for FR2052a for line items S.I.1,S.I.2,S.I.4 and S.I.5.
This attribute indicates whether the party is a qualified central counterparty for clearing trades.
Refers to the record creation date. It has been added to all catalog entities to enable partitioning and archival.
Refers to the run identifier for a set of Records participating in the particular Run with the Run Execution identifier. This is a combination of Run Main Identifier and Run Execution Identifier.

Flag Indicates whether the asset is segregated or not. For FR2052a in line S.I.9 Sleeper Collateral Deliverable we have to report the fair value of unsegregated collateral that the reporting entity may be required by contract to return to a counterparty because the collateral currently held by the reporting entity exceeds the current collateral requirements of counterparty under the governing contract and the fair value of collateral that the reporting entity is contractually obligated to post to a counterparty, but has not yet posted as it has not yet been called by the counterparty of reporting entity. List of values are Y and N.

Flag indicates whether any of the contract settlement is in dispute. For FR2052a in line S.I.7: Collateral Disputes Deliverables we require to report fair value of collateral called by the reporting entityâ€™s counterparties that the reporting entity has yet to deliver due to a dispute. Disputes include, but are not limited to, valuation of derivative contracts. List of values are Y and N.

Refers to the settlement mechanisms used for secured and foreign exchange products. Expected values for secured tables are T  TRIPARTY, B  BILATERAL and O OTHER. Expected values for foreign exchange tables are C CLS,B  BILATERAL and O  OTHER.

attributes.logicalName: Time To Collateral Posting In Days
attributes.gcd: Refers to Time to Collateral Posting in days. Time to collateral posting is the time after rating of the legal entity are downgraded and there is requirement to post additional collateral.
Refers to the total number of days margin dispute has occurred across all trades in the particular netting set for last two financial quarters.

governance.dqDesc: Should have list of values as N,Y
governance.dqType: List of Values or Code Check

governance.dqDesc: Should have list of values as N,Y
governance.dqType: List of Values or Code Check

governance.dqDesc: Should have list of values as N,Y
governance.dqType: List of Values or Code Check

governance.dqDesc: Reference Check for As Of Date in Stage Net Exposures
Reference Check for As Of Date in Stage Net Exposures
Reference Check for ISO Currency Code in Stage Net Exposures
Reference Check for Party Identifier in Stage Net Exposures
Reference Check for Data Source Code in Stage Net Exposures
Reference Check for Legal Entity Code in Stage Net Exposures
Reference Check for Netting Agreement Code in Stage Net Exposures
Reference Check for Collateral Settlement Type in Stage Net Exposures
Reference Check for Settlement Type in Stage Net Exposures
